trans-unit.source: Conception de services
trans-unit.target: Conception de services

trans-unit.source: Partition la charge de travail.
trans-unit.target: Partition la charge de travail.

trans-unit.source: Conception des parties du processus d'être discret et décomposable et réduire au minimum la taille de chaque pièce tout en respectant les règles typiques pour la séparation des préoccupations et le principe de responsabilité unique.
trans-unit.target: Conception des parties du processus d'être discret et décomposable et réduire au minimum la taille de chaque pièce tout en respectant les règles typiques pour la séparation des préoccupations et le principe de responsabilité unique.

trans-unit.source: Cela permet les composants à être distribué d'une manière qui maximise l'utilisation de chaque unité de calcul (tel qu'un serveur de base de données ou rôle) et rend plus facile à l'échelle de l'application en ajoutant des instances supplémentaires de ressources spécifiques.
trans-unit.target: Cela permet les composants à être distribué d'une manière qui maximise l'utilisation de chaque unité de calcul (tel qu'un serveur de base de données ou rôle) et rend plus facile à l'échelle de l'application en ajoutant des instances supplémentaires de ressources spécifiques.

trans-unit.source: Pour plus d'informations, consultez <link><linkText>Calculer l'orientation de partitionnement</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Conception pour la mise à l'échelle.
trans-unit.target: Conception pour la mise à l'échelle.

trans-unit.source: Scaling allows applications to react to variable load by increasing and decreasing the number of instances of roles, queues, and other services they use.
trans-unit.target: Scaling allows applications to react to variable load by increasing and decreasing the number of instances of roles, queues, and other services they use.

trans-unit.source: However, the application must be designed with this in mind.
trans-unit.target: However, the application must be designed with this in mind.

trans-unit.source: For example, the application and the services it uses must be stateless to allow requests to be routed to any instance, and so that the addition or removal of specific instances does not adversely impact current users.
trans-unit.target: For example, the application and the services it uses must be stateless to allow requests to be routed to any instance, and so that the addition or removal of specific instances does not adversely impact current users.

trans-unit.source: It is also necessary to implement configuration or auto-detection of instances as they are added and removed so that code in the application can perform the necessary routing.
trans-unit.target: It is also necessary to implement configuration or auto-detection of instances as they are added and removed so that code in the application can perform the necessary routing.

trans-unit.source: For example, a web application might use a set of queues in a round-robin approach to route requests to background services running in worker roles.
trans-unit.target: For example, a web application might use a set of queues in a round-robin approach to route requests to background services running in worker roles.

trans-unit.source: The web application must be able to detect changes in the number of queues in order to successfully route requests and balance the load on the application.
trans-unit.target: The web application must be able to detect changes in the number of queues in order to successfully route requests and balance the load on the application.

trans-unit.source: Échelle en tant qu'unité.
trans-unit.target: Échelle en tant qu'unité.

trans-unit.source: Plan pour l'ajout de ressources supplémentaires pour absorber la croissance.
trans-unit.target: Plan pour l'ajout de ressources supplémentaires pour absorber la croissance.

trans-unit.source: Pour chaque ressource, vous devez connaître la tige de mise à l'échelle des limites et utiliser sharding ou décomposition de dépasser ces limites.
trans-unit.target: Pour chaque ressource, vous devez connaître la tige de mise à l'échelle des limites et utiliser sharding ou décomposition de dépasser ces limites.

trans-unit.source: Déterminer les unités de l'échelle du système en termes d'ensembles bien définis des ressources.
trans-unit.target: Déterminer les unités de l'échelle du système en termes d'ensembles bien définis des ressources.

trans-unit.source: Cela rend échelle s'appliquant à des opérations plus facile et moins sujettes aux effets négatifs sur l'application par le biais de limitations imposées par le manque de ressources dans certaines parties de l'ensemble du système.
trans-unit.target: Cela rend échelle s'appliquant à des opérations plus facile et moins sujettes aux effets négatifs sur l'application par le biais de limitations imposées par le manque de ressources dans certaines parties de l'ensemble du système.

trans-unit.source: Par exemple, ajout x nombre de rôles web et de travail peut-être nécessiter y nombre de files d'attente supplémentaires et z des comptes de stockage pour gérer la charge de travail supplémentaire généré par les rôles, donc pourrait consister en une unité d'échelle x rôles web et de travail, et files d'attente, et avec comptes de stockage.
trans-unit.target: Par exemple, ajout x nombre de rôles web et de travail peut-être nécessiter y nombre de files d'attente supplémentaires et z des comptes de stockage pour gérer la charge de travail supplémentaire généré par les rôles, donc pourrait consister en une unité d'échelle x rôles web et de travail, et files d'attente, et avec comptes de stockage.

trans-unit.source: Concevoir l'application afin qu'il est facilement mis à l'échelle en ajoutant une ou plusieurs unités de l'échelle.
trans-unit.target: Concevoir l'application afin qu'il est facilement mis à l'échelle en ajoutant une ou plusieurs unités de l'échelle.

trans-unit.source: Éviter l'affinité du client.
trans-unit.target: Éviter l'affinité du client.

trans-unit.source: Si possible, faire en sorte que l'application ne nécessite pas d'affinité afin que les requêtes peuvent être acheminés vers n'importe quelle instance, et le nombre d'instances n'est pas pertinent.
trans-unit.target: Si possible, faire en sorte que l'application ne nécessite pas d'affinité afin que les requêtes peuvent être acheminés vers n'importe quelle instance, et le nombre d'instances n'est pas pertinent.

trans-unit.source: Cela permet également d'éviter la charge mémoire de stockage, la récupération et maintenir des informations d'État pour chaque utilisateur.
trans-unit.target: Cela permet également d'éviter la charge mémoire de stockage, la récupération et maintenir des informations d'État pour chaque utilisateur.

trans-unit.source: Tirer parti des fonctionnalités de plate-forme échelle automatique.
trans-unit.target: Tirer parti des fonctionnalités de plate-forme échelle automatique.

trans-unit.source: Où la plate-forme d'hébergement prend en charge une fonctionnalité d'autoscaling, tels que Azure Autoscaling, préfère lui personnalisé ou mécanismes de tiers à moins que le mécanisme intégré ne peut pas satisfaire vos besoins.
trans-unit.target: Où la plate-forme d'hébergement prend en charge une fonctionnalité d'autoscaling, tels que Azure Autoscaling, préfère lui personnalisé ou mécanismes de tiers à moins que le mécanisme intégré ne peut pas satisfaire vos besoins.

trans-unit.source: Utiliser les règles planifiées de mise à l'échelle où possible d'assurer des ressources sont disponibles sans un retard de démarrage, mais ajouter autoscaling réactive aux règles, le cas échéant faire face aux changements imprévus dans la demande.
trans-unit.target: Utiliser les règles planifiées de mise à l'échelle où possible d'assurer des ressources sont disponibles sans un retard de démarrage, mais ajouter autoscaling réactive aux règles, le cas échéant faire face aux changements imprévus dans la demande.

trans-unit.source: Vous pouvez utiliser les opérations autoscaling dans l'API de gestion de Service à l'échelle automatique peaufiner et ajoutez des compteurs personnalisés aux règles au-delà des options de configuration disponibles dans le portail web.
trans-unit.target: Vous pouvez utiliser les opérations autoscaling dans l'API de gestion de Service à l'échelle automatique peaufiner et ajoutez des compteurs personnalisés aux règles au-delà des options de configuration disponibles dans le portail web.

trans-unit.source: Pour plus d'informations, consultez la page <link><linkText>Guide de mise à l'échelle automatique</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Pour plus d'informations, consultez la page <link><linkText>Guide de mise à l'échelle automatique</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Offload intensive CPU/IO tasks as background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Offload intensive CPU/IO tasks as background tasks.

trans-unit.source: If a request to a service is expected to take a long time to run or absorb considerable resources, then offload the processing for this request to a separate task.
trans-unit.target: If a request to a service is expected to take a long time to run or absorb considerable resources, then offload the processing for this request to a separate task.

trans-unit.source: Use worker roles or background jobs (depending on the hosting platform) to execute these tasks.
trans-unit.target: Use worker roles or background jobs (depending on the hosting platform) to execute these tasks.

trans-unit.source: This strategy enables the service to continue receiving further requests and remain responsive.
trans-unit.target: This strategy enables the service to continue receiving further requests and remain responsive.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Orientation de travaux de fond</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Orientation de travaux de fond</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Distribute the workload for background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Distribute the workload for background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Where there are many background tasks, or the tasks require considerable time or resources, spread the work across multiple compute units (such as worker roles or background jobs).
trans-unit.target: Where there are many background tasks, or the tasks require considerable time or resources, spread the work across multiple compute units (such as worker roles or background jobs).

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>Modèle de consommateurs concurrentes</linkText><title></title></link> provides one possible solution.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>Modèle de consommateurs concurrentes</linkText><title></title></link> provides one possible solution.

trans-unit.source: Consider moving towards a _shared nothing_ architecture.
trans-unit.target: Consider moving towards a _shared nothing_ architecture.

trans-unit.source: A shared nothing architecture uses independent and self-sufficient nodes that have no single point of contention such as shared services or storage.
trans-unit.target: A shared nothing architecture uses independent and self-sufficient nodes that have no single point of contention such as shared services or storage.

trans-unit.source: In theory, such a system can scale almost indefinitely.
trans-unit.target: In theory, such a system can scale almost indefinitely.

trans-unit.source: While a fully shared nothing approach is generally not practical for most applications, it may provide opportunities to design for better scalability.
trans-unit.target: While a fully shared nothing approach is generally not practical for most applications, it may provide opportunities to design for better scalability.

trans-unit.source: For example, avoiding the use of server-side session state, client affinity, and data partitioning are good examples of moving towards a shared nothing architecture.
trans-unit.target: For example, avoiding the use of server-side session state, client affinity, and data partitioning are good examples of moving towards a shared nothing architecture.

trans-unit.source: Gestion des données
trans-unit.target: Gestion des données

trans-unit.source: Use data partitioning.
trans-unit.target: Use data partitioning.

trans-unit.source: Divide the data across multiple databases and database servers, or design the application to use data storage services that can provide this partitioning transparently (examples include Azure SQL Database Elastic Scale, and Azure Table storage).
trans-unit.target: Divide the data across multiple databases and database servers, or design the application to use data storage services that can provide this partitioning transparently (examples include Azure SQL Database Elastic Scale, and Azure Table storage).

trans-unit.source: This approach can help to maximize performance and allow easier scaling.
trans-unit.target: This approach can help to maximize performance and allow easier scaling.

trans-unit.source: There are different partitioning techniques such as horizontal, vertical, and functional partitioning, and you can use a combination of these to achieve maximum benefit from increased query performance, simpler scalability, more flexible management, better availability, and to match the type of store to the data it will hold.
trans-unit.target: There are different partitioning techniques such as horizontal, vertical, and functional partitioning, and you can use a combination of these to achieve maximum benefit from increased query performance, simpler scalability, more flexible management, better availability, and to match the type of store to the data it will hold.

trans-unit.source: Also, consider using different types of data store for different types of data, choosing the types based on how well they are optimized for the specific type of data.
trans-unit.target: Also, consider using different types of data store for different types of data, choosing the types based on how well they are optimized for the specific type of data.

trans-unit.source: This may include using table storage, a document database, or a column-family data store instead of or as well as a relational database.
trans-unit.target: This may include using table storage, a document database, or a column-family data store instead of or as well as a relational database.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Conseils partitionnement de données</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Conseils partitionnement de données</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Design for eventual consistency.
trans-unit.target: Design for eventual consistency.

trans-unit.source: Eventual consistency improves scalability by reducing or removing the time needed to synchronize related data partitioned across multiple stores.
trans-unit.target: Eventual consistency improves scalability by reducing or removing the time needed to synchronize related data partitioned across multiple stores.

trans-unit.source: The cost is that data is not always consistent when it is read, and some write operations may cause conflicts.
trans-unit.target: The cost is that data is not always consistent when it is read, and some write operations may cause conflicts.

trans-unit.source: Eventual consistency is ideal for situations where the same data is read frequently but written infrequently.
trans-unit.target: Eventual consistency is ideal for situations where the same data is read frequently but written infrequently.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Data consistency guidance] (#insertlink#).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Data consistency guidance] (#insertlink#).

trans-unit.source: Reduce chatty interactions between components and services.
trans-unit.target: Reduce chatty interactions between components and services.

trans-unit.source: Avoid designing chatty interfaces for service, where an application is required to make multiple calls to a service (each of which returns a small amount of data) rather than a single call that can return all of the data.
trans-unit.target: Avoid designing chatty interfaces for service, where an application is required to make multiple calls to a service (each of which returns a small amount of data) rather than a single call that can return all of the data.

trans-unit.source: Where possible, combine several related operations into a single request when the call is to a service or component that has noticeable latency.
trans-unit.target: Where possible, combine several related operations into a single request when the call is to a service or component that has noticeable latency.

trans-unit.source: For example, use stored procedures in databases to encapsulate complex logic and reduce the number of round trips and resource locking.
trans-unit.target: For example, use stored procedures in databases to encapsulate complex logic and reduce the number of round trips and resource locking.

trans-unit.source: Use queues to level the load for high velocity data writes.
trans-unit.target: Use queues to level the load for high velocity data writes.

trans-unit.source: Surges in demand for a service can overwhelm that service and cause escalating failures.
trans-unit.target: Surges in demand for a service can overwhelm that service and cause escalating failures.

trans-unit.source: To prevent this, consider implementing the <link><linkText>Charge en fonction des file d'attente de mise à niveau modèle</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To prevent this, consider implementing the <link><linkText>Charge en fonction des file d'attente de mise à niveau modèle</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Use a queue that acts as a buffer between a task and a service that it invokes in order to smooth intermittent heavy loads that may otherwise cause the service to fail or the task to time out.
trans-unit.target: Use a queue that acts as a buffer between a task and a service that it invokes in order to smooth intermittent heavy loads that may otherwise cause the service to fail or the task to time out.

trans-unit.source: Minimize the load on the data store.
trans-unit.target: Minimize the load on the data store.

trans-unit.source: The data store is commonly a processing bottleneck, a costly resource, and is often not easy to scale out.
trans-unit.target: The data store is commonly a processing bottleneck, a costly resource, and is often not easy to scale out.

trans-unit.source: Where possible, remove logic (such as processing XML documents or JSON objects) from the data store and perform processing within the application.
trans-unit.target: Where possible, remove logic (such as processing XML documents or JSON objects) from the data store and perform processing within the application.

trans-unit.source: For example, instead of passing XML to the database (other than as an opaque string for storage) serialize or deserialize the XML within the application layer and pass it in a form that is native to the data store.
trans-unit.target: For example, instead of passing XML to the database (other than as an opaque string for storage) serialize or deserialize the XML within the application layer and pass it in a form that is native to the data store.

trans-unit.source: It is typically much easier to scale out the application than the data store, and so you should attempt to do as much of the compute-intensive processing within the application
trans-unit.target: It is typically much easier to scale out the application than the data store, and so you should attempt to do as much of the compute-intensive processing within the application

trans-unit.source: Minimize the volume of data retrieved.
trans-unit.target: Minimize the volume of data retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve only the data you require by specifying columns and using criteria to select rows.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve only the data you require by specifying columns and using criteria to select rows.

trans-unit.source: Make use of table value parameters and the appropriate isolation level.
trans-unit.target: Make use of table value parameters and the appropriate isolation level.

trans-unit.source: Use ETags to avoid retrieving data unnecessarily.
trans-unit.target: Use ETags to avoid retrieving data unnecessarily.

trans-unit.source: Aggressively use caching.
trans-unit.target: Aggressively use caching.

trans-unit.source: Use caching wherever possible to reduce the load on resources and services that generate or deliver data.
trans-unit.target: Use caching wherever possible to reduce the load on resources and services that generate or deliver data.

trans-unit.source: Caching is typically suited to data that is relatively static, or that requires considerable processing to obtain.
trans-unit.target: Caching is typically suited to data that is relatively static, or that requires considerable processing to obtain.

trans-unit.source: Caching should occur at all levels where appropriate in each layer of the application, including data access and UI generation.
trans-unit.target: Caching should occur at all levels where appropriate in each layer of the application, including data access and UI generation.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <link><linkText>Caching Guidance</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <link><linkText>Caching Guidance</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Handle data growth and retention.
trans-unit.target: Handle data growth and retention.

trans-unit.source: The amount of data stored by an application will grow over time.
trans-unit.target: The amount of data stored by an application will grow over time.

trans-unit.source: This growth will increase storage costs, and increase latency when accessing the data—which affects application throughput and performance.
trans-unit.target: This growth will increase storage costs, and increase latency when accessing the data—which affects application throughput and performance.

trans-unit.source: It may be possible to periodically archive some of the old data that is no longer accessed, or move data that is rarely accessed into long-term storage that is more cost efficient even of the access latency is higher.
trans-unit.target: It may be possible to periodically archive some of the old data that is no longer accessed, or move data that is rarely accessed into long-term storage that is more cost efficient even of the access latency is higher.

trans-unit.source: Optimize DTOs using an efficient binary format.
trans-unit.target: Optimize DTOs using an efficient binary format.

trans-unit.source: Data Transfer Objects are passed between the layers of an application many times, and so minimizing the size will reduce the load on resources and the network.
trans-unit.target: Data Transfer Objects are passed between the layers of an application many times, and so minimizing the size will reduce the load on resources and the network.

trans-unit.source: However, balance the savings with the overhead of converting the data to the required format in each location where it is used, and adopt a format that has the maximum interoperability to enable easy reuse of a component.
trans-unit.target: However, balance the savings with the overhead of converting the data to the required format in each location where it is used, and adopt a format that has the maximum interoperability to enable easy reuse of a component.

trans-unit.source: Set cache control.
trans-unit.target: Set cache control.

trans-unit.source: Design and configure the application to use output caching or fragment caching where possible to minimize processing load.
trans-unit.target: Design and configure the application to use output caching or fragment caching where possible to minimize processing load.

trans-unit.source: Enable client side caching.
trans-unit.target: Enable client side caching.

trans-unit.source: Web applications should enable cache settings on the content that can be cached.
trans-unit.target: Web applications should enable cache settings on the content that can be cached.

trans-unit.source: This is commonly disabled by default.
trans-unit.target: This is commonly disabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Configure the server to deliver the appropriate cache control headers to enable caching of content on proxy servers and clients.
trans-unit.target: Configure the server to deliver the appropriate cache control headers to enable caching of content on proxy servers and clients.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure blob storage and the CDN to reduce the load on the application.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure blob storage and the CDN to reduce the load on the application.

trans-unit.source: Consider storing static or relatively static public content such as images, resources, scripts, and style sheets in blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Consider storing static or relatively static public content such as images, resources, scripts, and style sheets in blob storage.

trans-unit.source: This approach relieves the application of the load caused by dynamically generating this content for each request.
trans-unit.target: This approach relieves the application of the load caused by dynamically generating this content for each request.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, consider using CDN to cache this content and deliver it to clients.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, consider using CDN to cache this content and deliver it to clients.

trans-unit.source: Using CDN can improve performance at the client because the content is delivered from the geographically closest datacenter that contains a CDN cache.For more information, see the <link><linkText>CDN Guidance</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Using CDN can improve performance at the client because the content is delivered from the geographically closest datacenter that contains a CDN cache.For more information, see the <link><linkText>CDN Guidance</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Optimize and tune SQL queries and indexes.
trans-unit.target: Optimize and tune SQL queries and indexes.

trans-unit.source: Some T-SQL statements or constructs may have an impact on performance that can be reduced by optimizing the code in a stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: Some T-SQL statements or constructs may have an impact on performance that can be reduced by optimizing the code in a stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: For example, converting datetime types to a varchar before comparing with a datetime literal value should be avoided—use date/time comparison functions instead.
trans-unit.target: For example, converting datetime types to a varchar before comparing with a datetime literal value should be avoided—use date/time comparison functions instead.

trans-unit.source: Lack of appropriate indexes can slow query execution.
trans-unit.target: Lack of appropriate indexes can slow query execution.

trans-unit.source: If you use an object/relational mapping (ORM) framework, understand how it works and how it may affect performance of the data access layer.
trans-unit.target: If you use an object/relational mapping (ORM) framework, understand how it works and how it may affect performance of the data access layer.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Query Tuning</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Query Tuning</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Consider de-normalizing data.
trans-unit.target: Consider de-normalizing data.

trans-unit.source: Data normalization helps to avoid duplication and inconsistency.
trans-unit.target: Data normalization helps to avoid duplication and inconsistency.

trans-unit.source: However, maintaining multiple indexes, checking for referential integrity, performing multiple accesses to small chucks of data, and joining tables to reassemble the data imposes an overhead that can affect performance.
trans-unit.target: However, maintaining multiple indexes, checking for referential integrity, performing multiple accesses to small chucks of data, and joining tables to reassemble the data imposes an overhead that can affect performance.

trans-unit.source: Consider if some additional storage volume and duplication is acceptable in order to reduce the load on the data store.
trans-unit.target: Consider if some additional storage volume and duplication is acceptable in order to reduce the load on the data store.

trans-unit.source: Also, consider if the application itself (which will typically be easier to scale) can be relied upon to take over tasks such as managing referential integrity in order to reduce the load on the data store.
trans-unit.target: Also, consider if the application itself (which will typically be easier to scale) can be relied upon to take over tasks such as managing referential integrity in order to reduce the load on the data store.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Conseils partitionnement de données</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Conseils partitionnement de données</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Service implementation
trans-unit.target: Service implementation

trans-unit.source: Use asynchronous calls.
trans-unit.target: Use asynchronous calls.

trans-unit.source: Wherever possible use asynchronous code when accessing resources or services that may be limited by I/O or network bandwidth, or that have a noticeable latency, to avoid locking the calling thread.
trans-unit.target: Wherever possible use asynchronous code when accessing resources or services that may be limited by I/O or network bandwidth, or that have a noticeable latency, to avoid locking the calling thread.

trans-unit.source: Use the Task-based Asynchronous Pattern to implement asynchronous operations.
trans-unit.target: Use the Task-based Asynchronous Pattern to implement asynchronous operations.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <link><linkText>Task-based Asynchronous Pattern (TAP)</linkText><title></title></link> page sur le site Web de Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <link><linkText>Task-based Asynchronous Pattern (TAP)</linkText><title></title></link> page sur le site Web de Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Avoid locking resources and use an optimistic approach instead.
trans-unit.target: Avoid locking resources and use an optimistic approach instead.

trans-unit.source: Never lock access to resources such as storage or other services that have noticeable latency, because this is a primary cause of poor performance.
trans-unit.target: Never lock access to resources such as storage or other services that have noticeable latency, because this is a primary cause of poor performance.

trans-unit.source: Always use optimistic approaches to managing concurrent operations such as writing to storage, and use the features of the storage to manage conflicts.
trans-unit.target: Always use optimistic approaches to managing concurrent operations such as writing to storage, and use the features of the storage to manage conflicts.

trans-unit.source: In distributed applications, data may be only eventually consistent.
trans-unit.target: In distributed applications, data may be only eventually consistent.

trans-unit.source: Compress highly compressible data over high latency, low bandwidth networks.
trans-unit.target: Compress highly compressible data over high latency, low bandwidth networks.

trans-unit.source: In the majority of cases in a web application, the largest volume of data generated by the application and passed over the network is HTTP responses to client requests.
trans-unit.target: In the majority of cases in a web application, the largest volume of data generated by the application and passed over the network is HTTP responses to client requests.

trans-unit.source: HTTP compression can reduce this considerably, especially for static content.
trans-unit.target: HTTP compression can reduce this considerably, especially for static content.

trans-unit.source: This can offer a saving in cost as well as reducing the load on the network, though compressing dynamic content does apply a fractionally higher load on the server.
trans-unit.target: This can offer a saving in cost as well as reducing the load on the network, though compressing dynamic content does apply a fractionally higher load on the server.

trans-unit.source: In other more generalized environments, data compression can reduce the volume of data transmitted to minimize transfer time and costs, but adds an overhead for the compression and decompression processes.
trans-unit.target: In other more generalized environments, data compression can reduce the volume of data transmitted to minimize transfer time and costs, but adds an overhead for the compression and decompression processes.

trans-unit.source: It should be used only when there is a demonstrable gain in performance.

trans-unit.target: Send requests in batches to optimize network use.

trans-unit.source: Avoid a requirement to store server-side session state where possible.
trans-unit.target: Avoid a requirement to store server-side session state where possible.
